0.Title: The Coveted Starting Player
0.Description: Other players may transfer this card to their playing area for 1 of any of the following: Stone, Clay, Silk, Boar, Glass, Gold, Cattle, Vegetable, Food.
0.Snark: Because just going around in a circle is not strategic enough.

1.Title: The Building Building Building
1.Description: You may now build buildings. You may only take one of these into your hand per game.
1.Snark: Really, it's just a coincidence that we happen to also be housed in a building. In fact, we built our own building. We did not need a building building building building building.

2.Title: The Building Building Building

5.Title: The Military Strategy
5.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In the case of a tie, nobody gets the bonus. You may only own 1 Military Engine.
5.Snark: This strategy worked for me once. I think.

6.Title: The Reaction to Military Strategy
6.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In the case of a tie, nobody gets the bonus. You may only own 1 Military Engine.
6.Snark: If this card is available, somebody better take this.

7.Title: The Reaction to Military Strategy
7.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource, once per turn. In the case of a tie, nobody gets the bonus. You may only own 1 Military Engine.

8.Title: The Grain Engine
8.Description: You may use 1 Grain instead of any 1 Resource, any number of times.
8.Snark: A solid choice, but be sure to commit to it.

62.Title: Free Food!
62.Snark: Plus, you don't have to think about how to make your food!

64.Snark: Plus, you don't have to think about how to make your food!

65.Title: The Early Investment
65.Description: You must play this card before playing an Engine.
65.Snark: Does nothing now, but it will pay off later. The engine can wait.

66.Title: More Grain!
66.Description: You may trash this card for 1 Food.
66.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

67.Title: More Veggies!
67.Description: You may trash this card for 2 Food.
67.Snark: What's better than one veggie? Two veggies and a VP.

68.Title: The Wildcard Building
68.Description: You may Trash 1 Silk for any 2 Resources, any number of times.
68.Snark: Be sure to take this from someone who has collected silk.

69.Title: Sheep Breed!
69.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

70.Title: Sheep Breed!
70.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

71.Title: Sheep Breed!
71.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

72.Title: The Stone Building Building
72.Description: You do not need to pay any required Stone for Buildings.
72.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need stone for our building.

73.Title: The Wood Building Building
73.Description: You do not need to pay any required Wood for Buildings
73.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need Wood for our building.

74.Title: The Clay Building Building
74.Description: You do not need to pay any required Clay for Buildings.
74.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need Clay for our building.

75.Title: The Cattle Engine
75.Description: You may trash 1 Cattle for 2 Food, and/or 1 Cattle for any Resource.
75.Snark: Don't base your entire strategy on this card.

76.Title: The Obligatory Trader
76.Description: You may substitute 2 different Resources for 1 of any Resource, any number of times.
76.Snark: I'm sure I'll use this enough to justify its purchase.

77.Title: The Military Building
77.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. Ties don't count. You may only play this if you already have at least 1 Military.
77.Snark: And how do we feel about going military right about now?

78.Title: Even More Grain!
78.Description: You may also use this card for 1 Food
78.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

79.Title: Even More Grain!
79.Description: You may also use this card for 1 Food
79.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

80.Title: The Cheap Building
80.Snark: Hey, VPs are VPs. Every little bit counts.

81.Title: The Fine Building
81.Snark: Nice! Way to get some points on the board.

82.Title: The Good Building
82.Snark: Good move. Not Great. But Good.

83.Title: The Amazing Building
83.Snark: Don't get all your VPs out too early now. We've got an endgame.

84.Title: The Great Building
84.Snark: Just when you think you've pulled ahead, someone else will get a bigger building than this.

85.Title: The Premium Building
85.Snark: Seems like a lot now, but we have an epic endgame coming up.

86.Title: Cattle Breed!
86.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

87.Title: Cattle Breed!
87.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

88.Title: Even More Veggies!
88.Description: You may also Trash this card for 2 Food.
88.Snark: This is a garden, not some sort of weird patch that passively injects beta-Carotene into your skin.

89.Title: Even More Veggies!
89.Description: You may also Trash this card for 2 Food.
89.Snark: This is a garden, not some sort of weird patch that passively injects beta-Carotene into your skin.

90.Title: The Arms Race
90.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. In case of tie, nobody gets the bonus.
90.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

91.Title: The Arms Race
91.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. In case of tie, nobody gets the bonus.
91.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

92.Title: The Military Commitment
92.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. In case of tie, nobody gets the bonus.

93.Title: The Unfair Deck Dive
93.Description: Upon playing, you may retrieve any card in the discard piles and play it immediately without prerequisites.
93.Snark: Playing this has the hidden advantage of making your opponents hate you.

94.Title: The One-and-Done Card
94.Description: You may trash this card for any 2 Resources.
94.Snark: Make it count. No pressure. Are you sure you that's a good enough use for this card?? There's probably a better move.

95.Title: Pay Up!
95.Description: All players have their last chance to get rid of their Blockers.
95.Snark: Even though you knew it was coming, it still comes up too soon.

96.Title: The Payoff Payoff
96.Description: 4 VPs for each Payoff you have placed.
96.Snark: This card is as close at this game gets to Victory Point Points.

97.Title: The Expensive Payoff
97.Snark: Glad you didn't have to eat these!

98.Title: The Unexpected Payoff
98.Snark: This card favors those who have this deck memorized.

99.Title: The Diversified Strategy Payoff
99.Description: 3 VP for one of each of: Sheep, Wild Boar, Cattle, Glass, Silk, Grain, Veggie.
99.Snark: This is to make you feel better about having unused stuff.

100.Title: The Investment Payoff
100.Description: 6VP if you have Invested plus 2VP for each Gold.
100.Snark: See! I told you that card would pay off.

101.Title: The Unused Resources Payoff
101.Description: 2 VP for each Wood, Sheep, or Grain
101.Snark: Hey, at least you know nobody else is going for it.

102.Title: The Payoff With Math
102.Description: At game end, VPs are the number of Glass you have in your hand squared plus the number of Silks squared.
102.Snark: Go ahead and take your next turn, this is gonna take me a moment.

103.Title: The Military Payoff
103.Description: 4 VP for each Military, +2 additional VP if you end the game with the most military (ties don't count).

104.Title: The Building Payoff Building
104.Description: 3 VP for each Building you've played
104.Snark: You had to see this one coming.
